about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: A driver should:
hasPart.assesses: A driver should: | A driver should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A driver should watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car. To be a good driver, you must know what is happening all around your vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stare directly in front of their car.

comment.text: Stare directly in front of their car.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only focus on the middle of the road.

comment.text: Only focus on the middle of the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car.

comment.text: Watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car.

acceptedAnswer.text: Watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car.

comment.text: Watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car.

answerExplanation.text: A driver should watch beside, ahead, and to the rear of their car. To be a good driver, you must know what is happening all around your vehicle.

hasPart.name: It is illegal to leave a child age ____ or younger alone in a vehicle.

about.name: It is illegal to leave a child age ____ or younger alone in a vehicle.

hasPart.assesses: It is illegal to leave a child age ____ or younger alone in a vehicle. | It is illegal to leave a child age ____ or younger alone in a vehicle. -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is never a good idea to leave a child unattended in a car. It is illegal to leave a child who is age six or younger unattended in a vehicle. A child may be left in a car if they are under the supervision of a person age 12 or older.

comment.text: Eight
Seven
Six
Six

answerExplanation.text: It is never a good idea to leave a child unattended in a car. It is illegal to leave a child who is age six or younger unattended in a vehicle. A child may be left in a car if they are under the supervision of a person age 12 or older.

comment.text: It is illegal to leave a child age ____ or younger alone in a vehicle. | It is never a good idea to leave a child unattended in a car. It is illegal to leave a child who is age six or younger unattended in a vehicle. A child may be left in a car if they are under the supervision of a person age 12 or older.

hasPart.name: This sign is a:
hasPart.assesses: This sign is a: | This sign is a: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

comment.text: Service sign.
Regulatory sign.
Warning sign.
Warning sign.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

comment.text: This sign is a: | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. There may be an upcoming change in traffic direction, a steep downgrade, or another potentially hazardous situation that requires action on the part of the driver.

hasPart.name: Always stop before crossing railroad tracks when:

about.name: Always stop before crossing railroad tracks when:

hasPart.assesses: Always stop before crossing railroad tracks when: | Always stop before crossing railroad tracks when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Expect a train on any track, at any time, traveling in either direction. If you need to stop after crossing the tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

comment.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

suggestedAnswer.text: The railroad crossing is located in a city or town that has frequent train traffic.

comment.text: The railroad crossing is located in a city or town that has frequent train traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are transporting two or more young children in a passenger vehicle.

comment.text: You are transporting two or more young children in a passenger vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

comment.text: There isn't room on the other side for you to completely cross the tracks.

answerExplanation.text: Expect a train on any track, at any time, traveling in either direction. If you need to stop after crossing the tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

comment.text: Always stop before crossing railroad tracks when: | Expect a train on any track, at any time, traveling in either direction. If you need to stop after crossing the tracks, wait until you can completely cross the tracks before proceeding. Make sure your vehicle clears the tracks before you stop.

hasPart.name: When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must:

about.name: When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must:

hasPart.assesses: When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must: | When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: The flashing overhead lights and stop arm on a school bus will be activated when the bus is stopped to load or unload students. If approaching a bus using these signals, you may not proceed until the red lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm has been retracted. Never pass a school bus that is dropping off or picking up students.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow to a speed no faster than 10 mph.

comment.text: Slow to a speed no faster than 10 mph.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop until the lights stop flashing.

comment.text: Stop until the lights stop flashing.
Change lanes and pass cautiously.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop until the lights stop flashing.

comment.text: Stop until the lights stop flashing.

answerExplanation.text: The flashing overhead lights and stop arm on a school bus will be activated when the bus is stopped to load or unload students. If approaching a bus using these signals, you may not proceed until the red lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm has been retracted. Never pass a school bus that is dropping off or picking up students.

comment.text: When a school bus is stopped ahead on your side of the road with its red lights flashing, you must: | The flashing overhead lights and stop arm on a school bus will be activated when the bus is stopped to load or unload students. If approaching a bus using these signals, you may not proceed until the red lights have stopped flashing and the stop arm has been retracted. Never pass a school bus that is dropping off or picking up students.

hasPart.name: Blind spots are:
hasPart.assesses: Blind spots are: | Blind spots are: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When changing lanes, look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. Check for obstructions near the rear corners of your vehicle. These areas are called “blind spots” because you cannot see them by using your mirrors.

suggestedAnswer.text: Spots in your vision when you become fatigued.

comment.text: Spots in your vision when you become fatigued.

suggestedAnswer.text: Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.

comment.text: Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.
Traffic control devices.

acceptedAnswer.text: Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.

comment.text: Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.

answerExplanation.text: When changing lanes, look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. Check for obstructions near the rear corners of your vehicle. These areas are called “blind spots” because you cannot see them by using your mirrors.

comment.text: Blind spots are: | When changing lanes, look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. Check for obstructions near the rear corners of your vehicle. These areas are called “blind spots” because you cannot see them by using your mirrors.
